Details: Both Agent1_SQLServer_Doc and Agent2_SQLServer_Doc provide comprehensive documentation for SQL Server customer order analysis queries. Agent1_SQLServer_Doc presents content in a structured format with clear numbered sections, while Agent2_SQLServer_Doc uses markdown formatting with better visual hierarchy. Both cover identical technical concepts including CTEs, joins, aggregations, and performance optimization. The semantic alignment is very high as both address the same business problem and technical implementation. Structural differences exist primarily in formatting and organization approach, but logical flow remains consistent. Both outputs demonstrate high technical accuracy with proper SQL Server terminology and concepts.

Both outputs address identical business objectives: generating customer order summaries from raw transactional data. Core concepts are aligned including customer analytics (lines 15-20 in both), revenue optimization (lines 25-30), and data warehousing principles (lines 10-15). Technical terminology is consistent across both outputs with proper use of SQL Server concepts like CTEs, joins, and aggregations. Minor semantic differences include Agent2_SQLServer_Doc's more explicit mention of SQL Server 2017+ requirements (line 180) and slightly different emphasis on business benefits (lines 20-25). Both correctly identify the same source tables, transformations, and output structure.

Structural organization differs significantly between outputs. Agent1_SQLServer_Doc uses numbered sections (1-10) with consistent subsection formatting, while Agent2_SQLServer_Doc employs markdown headers with hierarchical organization. Both follow similar logical progression: Overview → Structure → Data Flow → Mapping → Performance → Technical Elements → Complexity → Dependencies → Outputs → Error Handling. Agent1_SQLServer_Doc provides more granular subsections within each major section (lines 50-100), while Agent2_SQLServer_Doc uses cleaner markdown formatting with better visual separation (lines 60-120). Content ordering is nearly identical, but presentation methodology creates structural variance.

Agent1_SQLServer_Doc demonstrates high syntactic correctness with proper section numbering, consistent formatting, and accurate technical terminology. Average correctness score of 96.5 rounded to 97. Both outputs demonstrate high technical accuracy and proper formatting within their respective presentation styles.

Improve formatting consistency by standardizing bullet point usage and reducing repetitive content in performance optimization sections. Consider adopting markdown formatting for better readability and professional presentation.
Address minor spacing inconsistency in API cost section. Consider adding more granular subsections within major sections to match the detailed breakdown approach of Agent1_SQLServer_Doc.
